channel.title: How do i save a camastia movie as .gif
channel.description:
ikiliki told me it was possible, but its saving it in movie files, He said you can make it a gif animated thingy like this:
[img]http://img217.imageshack.us/img217/2296/kq0aq.gif[/img]

item.title: How do i save a camastia movie as .gif
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You need PhotoShop CS3, or ImageReady CS2, you need to open the movie file, and then do the editing, after that, go to Save as Web Image. Then save it as a .Gif

Read full topic
item.source: How do i save a camastia movie as .gif

item.title: How do i save a camastia movie as .gif
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Frell:

Im not sure, but i dont want to make it with a whole bunch of different images, i want to record like a vid.

I thought ImageReady should be able to open movie files and save as gif.

h44ckzor pwnage:

On the Task List to the left, Produce video as > Then click Custom Production Settings then seletc .gif from the bottom.

Nice.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i save a camastia movie as .gif

item.title: How do i save a camastia movie as .gif
item.dc:creator: @h44ckzor_pwnage h44ckzor pwnage
item.description:
@h44ckzor_pwnage wrote:

On the Task List to the left, Produce video as > Then click Custom Production Settings then select .gif from the bottom.
